info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rutherford, east central Henderson and Polk Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Columbus, or 6 miles northeast of Saluda, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Lake Lure, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Bat Cave, Saluda, Dana, Mill Spring, Edneyville and Lake Adger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
